DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma Missing Value Reason Pigmentation java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin._A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available.  A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept.  In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.:Pigmentation; the coloring of the skin, hair, mucous membranes, and retina of the eye._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.
